unnormalised: Someone asked me if seeing a neurologist is worth it if you keep forgetting where you put your chai. Okay, look, if you're misplacing your spectacles more than your sanity, maybe it's time to book that appointment, bhai. Seriously though, forgetting things occasionally is normal – blaming it on that second cup of cutting chai is perfectly acceptable. However, if you're legit forgetting your own name or constantly misplacing your auto-rickshaw after bargaining for 10 minutes, then yeah, maybe Dr. Gupta at AIIMS, Delhi, should have a look.

unnormalised: Neurologists deal with the brain, which is kinda important, right? They can diagnose things like Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, and whether your brain cells are staging a dharna due to excessive Bollywood consumption. They might run tests like MRIs (Rs. 8000 at some clinics!) and EEGs to see what's going on in that noggin of yours. So, if your memory issues are interfering with your ability to remember your favourite biryani recipe or, god forbid, your cricket scores, it's probably time to get some expert advice. Don’t wait till you’re convinced your neighbour is your long-lost cousin.

unnormalised: Bottom line? Occasional forgetfulness? Chill, have some jalebi. Consistently forgetting major life events or experiencing other neurological symptoms (like, say, thinking you can actually sing like Lata Mangeshkar after too much masala dosa)? Prepone that neurologist appointment ASAP. Your brain will thank you… assuming you remember to thank it.
